result.execSummary:
The defendant Karl J Haines was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Petition to Expunge Court Record of Conviction

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Karl J Haines in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2,  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 1 and 3 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 2:
- 5 months jail straight time - credit for 47 days STAYED for   1 1/2 years Probation
- Court Costs of $443.00 (includes DV Surcharge of $200.00) - apply bail 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00  - apply bail and refund balance
- Conditions of  Probation: Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all RX.. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. Full-Time employment and/or combination of schooling. No violent contact with Heather H.. Domestic violence counseling through a State certified batterers intervention program. Follow all mental health recommendations of Defendant's treating doctors including compliance of meds.   
- 15 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours)  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion.

Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: October 1, 2014 Plea/Sentencing Hearing, October 2 Jury Status Hearing and October 7, 2014 Jury Trial.  Defendant no longer residing at the Waukesha County Jail.  Copies mailed to prior address.
